mustNotMiss.escalationConcern: Urgent ENT/emergency referral for post-auricular signs or persistent severe pain/fever.

whenHelpful.rationale: Helps detect physiological instability during consultation.
Used when findings will change immediate management.
Reserve for diagnostic uncertainty or higher risk presentations.

selfCare: Provide symptom-control advice tailored to current severity.
Confirm patient understands red-flag escalation instructions.
followUpLogic: Escalate immediately for mastoid, intracranial, or cranial nerve complication signs.
Review persistent symptoms or hearing concerns and consider reassessment pathway.
Provide explicit advice for worsening fever, pain, swelling, or neurological features.

returnAdvice: Seek urgent care for worsening pain with swelling behind the ear or pinna displacement.
Seek urgent care for persistent high fever, severe headache, or neck stiffness.
Return if hearing worsens, discharge persists, or symptoms fail to improve.
